security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill that generates git commit messages. It reads git staged data and executes git commands as its stated purpose. No obfuscated code, no data exfiltration, no persistence mechanisms detected.

content.user_title: Generate commit messages for staged changes
content.value_statement: Writing clear commit messages takes time and consistency varies between developers. This skill analyzes your staged changes and generates conventional commit messages following your project conventions. It reviews git data, suggests a message, and commits after your approval.
actual_capabilities: Review staged changes using git diff --staged
Check git status and recent commit history
Generate conventional commit messages (feat, fix, refactor, etc.)
Present message for user approval before committing
limitations: Requires git repository with staged changes
Does not stage files automatically - changes must be staged first
Message quality depends on change complexity and commit history context
Does not handle merge conflicts or complex git operations

faq.question: Does this skill stage files automatically?
faq.answer: No. You must stage files manually before running the commit skill. It only reviews already staged changes.

faq.question: Can I customize the commit message format?
faq.answer: The skill follows conventional commit types (feat, fix, refactor, test, docs, style, chore). Message structure is fixed.

faq.question: What if I want to edit the generated message?
faq.answer: The skill presents the message for your approval. You can request modifications before accepting.

faq.question: Does this skill access my git credentials?
faq.answer: No. It only reads git data (diff, status, log) and executes commit commands through standard git interfaces.

faq.question: Can I use this in non-git version control systems?
faq.answer: No. This skill is specifically designed for git and requires a git repository with staged changes.

faq.question: How is this different from other commit message tools?
faq.answer: This skill uses AI to understand your specific changes and generates context-aware messages following project conventions.
